channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Supreme Court allows Trump to withhold $4 billion in foreign aid
item.description: The court's majority said Trump's foreign policy authority outweighed the harms claimed by the international aid groups suing.
item.content:encoded:
The court's majority said Trump's foreign policy authority outweighed the harms claimed by the international aid groups suing.

(Image credit: Allison Robbert)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Assata Shakur, a fugitive Black militant sought by the U.S. since 1979, dies in Cuba
item.description: Assata Shakur, a Black liberation activist who was given political asylum in Cuba after her 1979 escape from a U.S. prison, has died. Officials in New Jersey, where Shakur had been arrested, convicted and imprisoned, said she was 78.
item.content:encoded:
Assata Shakur, a Black liberation activist who was given political asylum in Cuba after her 1979 escape from a U.S. prison, has died. Officials in New Jersey, where Shakur had been arrested, convicted and imprisoned, said she was 78.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: An influx of federal agents will arrive in Memphis next week, governor says
item.description: Tennessee Gov. Bill Lee said National Guard troops will serve in support roles to local law enforcement and not be tasked with making arrests.
item.content:encoded:
Tennessee Gov. Bill Lee said National Guard troops will serve in support roles to local law enforcement and not be tasked with making arrests.

(Image credit: Saul Loeb)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: There was a different vibe at the U.N. General Assembly. 5 attendees weigh in
item.description: It's the first high level U.N. gathering since the U.S. foreign aid cuts under the Trump Administration. What were people thinking — and talking about?
item.content:encoded:
It's the first high level U.N. gathering since the U.S. foreign aid cuts under the Trump Administration. What were people thinking — and talking about?

(Image credit: Jakub Porzycki/NurPhoto)
item.dc:creator: Fatma Tanis

item.title: What upheaval at DOJ may mean for rule of law in America
item.description: The indictment of former FBI director James Comey is one part of a dramatic escalation in President Trump's effort to remake the Department of Justice.
item.content:encoded:
The indictment of former FBI director James Comey is one part of a dramatic escalation in President Trump's effort to remake the Department of Justice.

(Image credit: Eric Lee)
item.dc:creator: Carrie Johnson

item.title: For LGBTQ+ History Month, NPR wants to hear your coming out story
item.description: National Coming Out Day is celebrated on Oct. 11 to recognize the courage of LGBTQ+ individuals who come out publicly. This year, NPR is inviting people to share their coming out stories.
item.content:encoded:
National Coming Out Day is celebrated on Oct. 11 to recognize the courage of LGBTQ+ individuals who come out publicly. This year, NPR is inviting people to share their coming out stories.

(Image credit: Aris Messinis)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: ICE officer caught on video pushing woman is placed on leave
item.description: The man appears to be the same officer who was caught last month on NPR audio aggressively arresting a court observer.
item.content:encoded:
The man appears to be the same officer who was caught last month on NPR audio aggressively arresting a court observer.

(Image credit: Stephanie Keith)
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo

item.title: Random act of kindness: Mariners fan gifts historic ball to young stranger
item.description: A fan caught Cal Raleigh's history-making 60th home run ball. He promptly turned the valuable memento over to 12-year-old Marcus Ruelos.
item.content:encoded: A fan caught Cal Raleigh's history-making 60th home run ball. He promptly turned the valuable memento over to 12-year-old Marcus Ruelos.
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: RFK Jr. 'rejects' a U.N. declaration on non-communicable diseases
item.description: Global health leaders expressed dismay at Kennedy's objection but vowed to move forward without the support of the U.S.
item.content:encoded:
Global health leaders expressed dismay at Kennedy's objection but vowed to move forward without the support of the U.S.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Gabrielle Emanuel

item.title: At U.N., amid jeers and cheers, Netanyahu says Israel 'must finish the job' in Gaza
item.description: The Israeli prime minister's speech was defiant, despite his growing international isolation over his refusal to end the devastating war to eradicate Hamas.
item.content:encoded:
The Israeli prime minister's speech was defiant, despite his growing international isolation over his refusal to end the devastating war to eradicate Hamas.

(Image credit: Stefan Jeremiah)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
